Module c486.c486assessmentproject
Package Controller

Class ModifyPartController

java.lang.Object
Controller.ModifyPartController
public class ModifyPartController extends Object
This is the ModifyPartController class that will enable the user to modify a selected part's data.
This class can do everything the AddPartController class can do.
Once the user selects a part to modify from the parts table on the main form screen and clicks the modify button, they will be redirected to this screen.
All the text fields will automatically populate with that parts' information.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    blankTextError()
    This method displays an alert error dialog box that tells user if a text field is left blank.
    void
    cancelToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method confirms with the user before returning the user to the main form if the Cancel button is clicked.
    void
    getSelectedPart(Part selectedPart)
    This method populates the texts fields in the modify screen with the selected part's information.
    It also gets the index of the selected part and initializes the static variable selectedIndex to be used with updatePart method.
    void
    onInHouse(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method sets the selectedOption label to "Machine ID" if the In-House radio button is selected.
    void
    onOutsourced(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method sets the selectedOption label to "Company Name" if the Outsourced radio button is selected.
    void
    saveModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method does everything the savePart method does in the AddPartController class, but instead of using the Inventory class's addPart method, it uses the Inventory updatePart method.
    This passes the selectedParts index as well as the newly created part into the updatePart method and replaces the old object with the new modified object.
    Method will return the user to the main form screen after clicking the save button.

  • Method Details

    • getSelectedPart

      public void getSelectedPart(Part selectedPart)
      This method populates the texts fields in the modify screen with the selected part's information.
      It also gets the index of the selected part and initializes the static variable selectedIndex to be used with updatePart method.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - - The part that was selected to be modified on the main form screen.

    • onInHouse

      public void onInHouse(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method sets the selectedOption label to "Machine ID" if the In-House radio button is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - - When the InHouse radio button is selected.

    • onOutsourced

      public void onOutsourced(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method sets the selectedOption label to "Company Name" if the Outsourced radio button is selected.
      Parameters:
      event - - When the Outsourced radio button is selected.

    • blankTextError

      public void blankTextError()
      This method displays an alert error dialog box that tells user if a text field is left blank.

    • saveModifyPart

      public void saveModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method does everything the savePart method does in the AddPartController class, but instead of using the Inventory class's addPart method, it uses the Inventory updatePart method.
      This passes the selectedParts index as well as the newly created part into the updatePart method and replaces the old object with the new modified object.
      Method will return the user to the main form screen after clicking the save button.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the user clicks the save button.
      Throws:
      IOException - - When the user enters a String value in a text field expecting a numerical value.

    • cancelToMain

      public void cancelToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method confirms with the user before returning the user to the main form if the Cancel button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Cancel button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - - When the FXML file cannot be found.
